reviewText: A dreamscape classic period western. Very funny, very sad. Loved it.
Kind of off-beat and not what one might expect from the title, but like-able , simple characters.  Worth watching.  Not one of the best movies ever, but way better than most.
Good movie, period type piece; but no real denouement. These characters were definitely people of few words!
Gorgeous, quiet film with beautiful performances and so much to enjoy.

Boring!  Watch people stare at a fire, cut wood, walk in the woods, read letters.  Shame on Richard Brody of "The New Yorker" for describing this tripe as "an instant-classic western."  Same goes for Alan Scherstuhl of the "The Village Voice" who calls it "a knockout feature debut."  Keep the names of these dimwits in mind along with the rags that hire them for film reviews the next time you look for critical reviews of movies.

The visuals  and scenery were pretty and nicely captured.  That was about it, though.  The story was basically what you'd get if you followed someone around with a camera and cut out most of the interesting parts.
The description says "black comedy" but I think it was meant to read "dark comedy". Horrible movie.
It's a funny film but moves pretty slowly. It was okay. I didn't love it or hate it.
This is a lovely film, creative, humane, engaging, and with a wonderful blend of humor and sadness. Highly recommended.
Simply beautiful!!  What a touching view of two brothers split by the civil war!
This is one of the most well filmed period movie I have ever seen, I have most all things related to the civil war.
Just an incredible film - such a feat.  Beautiful, moving, funny -- you will think about it long after you see it.
